meanings.definition: To cover with slime or a similar viscous substance.
meanings.sent1: The snail slimed its path across the garden.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally slimed my hand while playing with the gooey toy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child slimed the doorknob, making it slippery for anyone trying to open the door.
meanings.sent4: The monster in the movie slimed the unsuspecting victim, leaving them covered in a sticky mess.
meanings.sent5: The slimed surface of the pond made it difficult for the ducks to swim smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The frog slimed itself to protect its skin from drying out.
meanings.sent2: After falling into the swamp, I was completely slimed from head to toe.
meanings.sent3: The dog came running into the house, slimed with mud and dirt from the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman's boots were slimed with algae as he waded through the murky water.
meanings.sent5: The old well had been abandoned for years and was now slimed with green moss.

meanings.sent1: The slimed walls of the cave glistened in the dim light.
meanings.sent2: The slimed surface of the pond indicated poor water quality.
meanings.sent3: The slimed rocks along the riverbank were slippery to walk on.
meanings.sent4: The slimed creature emerged from the depths of the swamp, leaving a trail of goo behind.
meanings.sent5: The slimed tree trunk provided a perfect hiding spot for the frogs.
